intro: Geonoma rhytidocarpa, commonly known as the scaly-leaf fern, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, scaly fronds. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and can develop a rough, textured surface. Geonoma rhytidocarpa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and adaptability to indoor conditions.
